com.spotify.flo

Interface TaskContext<T,S>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TaskOperator<ContextT,SpecT,ResultT>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BigQueryOperator, BigQueryOutput, TaskContextGeneric, TaskOutput

    public interface TaskContext<T,S>
extends Serializable
    TaskContext interface for operation objects that will be injected into tasks.

    A task context is an object that is aware of the lifecycle of a task and can perform operations before and after the task evaluates. A common use case for task contexts is to be able to integrate 3rd party libraries into Flo in a way that makes them easily accessible to tasks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void onFail(Task<?> task, Throwable throwable)
      Will be called just after a task that is using this task context has failed evaluating.
      default void onSuccess(Task<?> task, S z)
      Will be called just after a task that is using this task context has successfully evaluated.
      default void preRun(Task<?> task)
      Will be called just before a task that is using this task context starts evaluating.
      T provide(EvalContext evalContext)
      Creates a new instance of type T.

    • Method Detail

      • provide

        T provide(EvalContext evalContext)
        Creates a new instance of type T. The given EvalContext will be the evaluation context for the task. The task itself can be accessed through EvalContext.currentTask().
        Parameters:
        evalContext - The evaluation context in which the current task is being evaluated
        Returns:
        An instance of the provided task context type

      • preRun

        default void preRun(Task<?> task)
        Will be called just before a task that is using this task context starts evaluating.
        Parameters:
        task - The task being evaluated

      • onSuccess

        default void onSuccess(Task<?> task,
                       S z)
        Will be called just after a task that is using this task context has successfully evaluated.
        Parameters:
        task - The task that evaluated
        z - The return value of the evaluated task

      • onFail

        default void onFail(Task<?> task,
                    Throwable throwable)
        Will be called just after a task that is using this task context has failed evaluating.
        Parameters:
        task - The task that evaluated
        throwable - The throwable that was thrown, causing the failure
